meanings.definition: Able to be carried or moved from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The small suitcase was transportable, making it easy for the child to carry.
meanings.sent2: The fragile items were carefully packed in transportable boxes for the move.
meanings.sent3: The transportable backpack seemed to have a mind of its own, swinging back and forth as if dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a transportable joy, spreading from person to person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The idea of freedom was as transportable as a feather in the wind, light and easily carried.

meanings.sent1: The heavy machinery was not very transportable due to its size.
meanings.sent2: The large truck was designed to be transportable across long distances.
meanings.sent3: The transportable penguin costume made everyone at the party giggle.
meanings.sent4: His smile was so bright, it was like a transportable beam of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers was as transportable as a sweet memory, lingering in the air.

meanings.sent1: The sturdy boxes were transportable and perfect for storing books.
meanings.sent2: The lightweight chairs were easily transportable for outdoor events.
meanings.sent3: The transportable umbrella kept spinning in the wind, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a transportable gift, always ready to be shared with others.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was as transportable as a whisper, floating through the room softly.
